page.title: 12T.RUSHTON HOUSES(PART 3)
page.content: THE 3 ACRE GARDEN LEADS D0WN T0 THE RIVER.IN THE GR0UNDS ARE THE MILL & THE MILL H0USE - BUILT AR0UND 1840 - 1850.THE MILL IS UNALTERED & IS IN G00D C0NDITI0N. THE MILLER'S HOUSE ADJOINS THE MILL.THE HOUSE ROOF HAS BEEN LIFTED TO SQUARE OFF THE UPPER STOREY. COL. BLOUNT WAS KIND ENOUGH TO SHOW US OVER THE MILL-HOUSE. HE ALSO GAVE US A VERY DETAILED HISTORY OF TARRANT RUSHTON HOUSE. THE VILLAGE IS NOT ON A MAIN THOROUGH - FARE AND THIS HAS MEANT THAT IT IS UNAFFECTED BY SURBURBAN LIVING. THE NARROW LANE IS EDGED WITH COW PARSLEY. COTTAGE GARDENS FLOURISH; SOME WITH CULTIVATED FLOWERS. A FEW FULL OF WILD? FLOWERS. THE EFFECT IS OF PEACEFUL HARMONY, WHERE BIRDS & INSECTS ARE ALLOWED TO THRIVE.
